section.p: This section describes the parameters required to create custom data. Log in to the SM GUI, navigate to Subscriber Manager> Custom Data tab.
To add custom data, click , add the information as described in the given table:

row.entry: This parameter indicates a unique name given to the custom data.

entry.p: This parameter selects the following context type from the drop-down list:
Note: When you create the Device, Accounts, Users, and Groups entities, the custom data is mapped based on the respective context type.
This parameter selects the following value type from the drop-down list:

li.p: Seen as BigInteger after it has been added.
Seen as BigDecimal after it has been added.
Seen as Time Duration after it has been added.

Seen as Date Time after it has been added. The value for this parameter is entered as a date+time converted to Unix Epoch format with 3 zeros (000) appended at the end because NCC needs the time in milliseconds. For example, if the date+time is 2019 June 1st 10:00:00, you must convert this to Unix Epoch time, which is 1559383200. Further, because NCC requires the value in milliseconds, you must include “000” and enter the value as: 1559383200000.
Seen as String after it has been added.
Seen as IP Address after it has been added.

row.entry: This parameter indicates whether the custom data is mandatory or not.
If this check box is checked, then every device (or other entity) should have this custom data.

entry.p: This parameter indicates whether it is a read only custom data.

An optional parameter that indicates if this is a read only custom data. If this is a read only custom data, it is not usable in rule actions to update/remove the custom data against a subscriber model entity instance.

row.entry: If this check box is checked, then it is not usable in rule actions to update or remove the custom data against a subscriber model entity instance.

entry.p: This parameter allows the definition of a list of Value Types (String, Integer, Decimal, IP Address) defined for all Context Types (Account, Device, User, Group).
When you add the custom data to a device or user or group or account,press the Enter key and click Save.
Note: The maximum value supported for the custom data when attached to Device/Account/Group/User is 1 MB.

row.entry: If this check box is selected, then defining a list of value types is supported.
This parameter indicates the security domain associated with the account.
Select the security domain from the drop-down list.
